# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + (length(lines) > 0 ? lines[end].len : 0) >= text_width
            push!(lines, Line())
        end
        lines[end].str *= word * " "
        lines[end].len += length(word) + 1  # Include space after the word
    end
    return lines
end

struct Line
    str::String
    len::Int
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Hello there, this is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_lines = wrap_string(text)
for line in wrapped_lines
    println(line.str)
end
# Output:
# Hello there, this is a
# very long string that
# needs to be wrapped into
# multiple lines.
```
